description.author: Piyush P Kurur
description.description:
Raaz is a cryptographic library for Haskell. The library
is designed with a special emphasis on using the type system of
Haskell to eliminate a large set of vulnerabilities like buffer
overflows, timing attacks etc. It also strives to achieve this
safety with no compromise on performance.

package-flags.name: opt-native
package-flags.description:
Use optimisation for the platform on which it is being built. Do not enable this
when cross compiling as it can break the implementation. Also tested only with gcc.

package-flags.name: vector128
package-flags.description:
Make use of vector instructions with size being 128. Do not enable this unless you have reasons
to. It is better to use opt-native and opt-vectorise and let gcc have a go at the portable implementation

package-flags.name: vector256
package-flags.description:
Make use of gcc vector instructions with size being 256. Do not enable this unless you have reasons
to. It is better to use opt-native and opt-vectorise and let gcc have a go at the portable implementation.

package-flags.name: vector512
package-flags.description: Make use of gcc vector instructions with size being 512.

package-flags.name: avx2
package-flags.description: Support avx2 optimisations. Warning: enable only if you are sure of support.

package-flags.name: linux-getrandom
package-flags.description: Use the getrandom for system entropy instead of /dev/urandom. Available only on linux kernel > 3.17.

package-flags.name: liquidhaskell
package-flags.description: Use liquid haskell form verifying properties. Only for developers.
